poem:
### Parenthood

Toys scatter the floor,  
echoes of laughter unwind,  
but twilight calls  
like a distant tide,  
pulling desires  
to the shoreline,  
where whispers  
tangle in the moonlight,  
and love becomes  
a quiet craft,  
patiently moored,  
seeking the right  
wind—  
to sail.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
